Key Match Events: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer in the 10th inning
David Fry hit a walk-homer in the 10th to win Game 3
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians had their chances, so many chances. They put pressure on the Yankees in every game, but couldn’t come up with big hits in key spots
Post-Match Reflections: Tanner Bibee couldn't hold back his tears
Steven Kwan said the Yankees were just a better team
Stephen Vogt told his players to keep their heads held high and remember the feeling they had right now
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians left 47 runners on base, finishing 9 of 47 (.191) with runners in scoring position
The club's World Series title drought — going back to 1948 — got another year older
Others: The Guardians' aggressive style — 'Guards Ball' as it became known — under first-year manager Stephen Vogt rarely materialized against the Yankees
